  • Uses of CheckerColor in com.luchersol.core.specialized_checkers

    Subclasses with type arguments of type CheckerColor in com.luchersol.core.specialized_checkers
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    CheckerColor
    A specialized checker for Color instances, providing a fluent API to assert various color properties such as equality, brightness, transparency, contrast, saturation, similarity, and hexadecimal representation.
    Methods in com.luchersol.core.specialized_checkers that return CheckerColor
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.check(Color color)
    Creates a new CheckerColor instance for the given color with a default name.
    static CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.check(Color color, String name)
    Creates a new CheckerColor instance for the given color and name.
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.hasAlpha(int alpha)
    Checks if the color has the specified alpha (transparency) value.
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.hasContrast(Color other)
    Checks if the color has sufficient contrast with another color using the default threshold (128).
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.hasContrast(Color other, double umbral)
    Checks if the color has sufficient contrast with another color using the specified threshold.
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.hasHexadecimal(String hex)
    Checks if the color's hexadecimal representation matches the specified string.
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isBlack()
    Checks if the color is black.
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isColor(Color other)
    Checks if the color is equal to another color.
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isDark()
    Checks if the color is considered dark using the default threshold (128).
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isDark(double umbral)
    Checks if the color is considered dark using the specified threshold.
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isDesaturated(double umbral)
    Checks if the color is desaturated (saturation below the specified threshold).
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isGray()
    Checks if the color is a shade of gray (red, green, and blue components are equal).
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isLight()
    Checks if the color is considered light using the default threshold (128).
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isLight(double umbral)
    Checks if the color is considered light using the specified threshold.
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isOpaque()
    Checks if the color is fully opaque (alpha value is 255).
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isSimilar(Color other, double umbral)
    Checks if the color is similar to another color within the specified threshold.
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isTransparent()
    Checks if the color is transparent (alpha value less than 255).
    CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.isWhite()
    Checks if the color is white.
    protected CheckerColor
    CheckerColor.self()
    Returns this instance (for fluent API usage).

    CheckerColor
    Checker.isColor()
